summary: A configurable fake quantum backend that mimics an IBM device using a local simulator, generating realistic properties (qubits, basis gates, coupling map, noise, calibrations, dtm) either randomly or from user‑provided values, and exposing the full backend interface for transpilation and circuit execution.
business_intent: Enable developers and testers to reliably develop and validate quantum software components—such as transpilers, calibration handling, and dynamic‑circuit support—without accessing real quantum hardware.
